gurmukhi: iem bwq jbY niRp qu suinXM ]
transliteration: Im Baat Jabai Nrip Tu Souniyan||
translation: When they heard the king saying in this manner,

gurmukhi: gH bYT sBY idj mMqR ikXM ]
transliteration: Grah Baith Sabhai Dij Mantra Kiyan||
translation: All the Brahmins sat in their houses and decided,

gurmukhi: Aj sYn AjY Bt dws suqM ]
transliteration: Aj Sain Ajai Bhat Daas Soutan||
translation: That this son of maid-servant is unconquerable hero and his army is unconquerable.
He is very stern and a man of vicious intellect and actions.7.297.

gurmukhi: iml Kwie qau KovY jnm jgM ]
transliteration: Mil Khaae Tau Khovai Janam Jagadg||
translation: If we eat in his company, then we lose our birth in the world;

gurmukhi: nih Kwq qu jwq hY kwl mgM ]
transliteration: Nah(i0 Khaat Tu Jaat Jai Kaal Magadg||
translation: If we do not eat, then we will have to go in the jaws of death.

gurmukhi: iml imqR su kIjY kaun mqM ]
transliteration: Mil Mitra Su Keejai Kaoun Matan||
translation: After assembling we should take such decision,

gurmukhi: ijh BwNq rhy jg Awj pqM ]8]298]
transliteration: Jih Bhaant Rahe Jag Aaj Patan||8||298||
translation: With which we keep up our honour in the world.8.298.
After taking decision, they said to the king : “O king of great intellect, listen,
“Thou art fearless and unconquerable monarch on the whole earth;
“Thou art unfathomable, bottomless and master of innumerable forces;
“Thou art invincible, unassailable and Soverrign of Supreme might.9.299.

gurmukhi: ieh Taur n CqRI eyk nhM ]
translation: “There is not even one Kshatriya in this place.
“O great and superb monarch, listen to his truth.”
